ZoneText: Husband, mom get life in dowry death case

Navi Mumbai: Panvel court on Wednesday sentenced the husband and the mother-in-law of a woman who was burnt alive by the duo over dowry seven years ago; to rigorous life term imprisonment and a fine of Rs 60,000. Additional sessions judge Jairaj D. Wadne pronounced the verdict.
Deceased Jyoti Mhatre's husband Nilesh Mhatre (35) and mother-in-law Malti Mhatre (53), both have been in Taloja jail for past seven years. The fine amount will be given as compensation to Jyoti’s father, complainant Hiraman Tawari, a resident of Rave, Pen taluka, Raigad.
While her father-in-law Ramkrishna Mhatre (58) and her sister-in-law’s husband Ankush Patil (41) were also accused in the case, they were acquitted by the court due to lack of evidence. Tawari had registered an FIR of dowry death and murder against the four accused on December 6, 2015. Jyoti was killed on May 2, 2015, at Kasarbhat. She was subjected to physical and mental harrassment. Her husband beat her and along with her in-laws poured kerosene on her and set her ablaze, said senior inspector Ravindra Daundkar from Panvel police station.
